t: Lamentations 3
The Prophet’s Anguish and Hope
I*pn am*i the man who*i has seen affliction by the rod of His wrath.
He*ld has led me and made me*i walk In*ild darkness and not in*i light.
Surely*ld He has turned His hand against me Time*ld and time again throughout the day.
He*ln has aged my flesh and my skin, And*ld broken my bones.
He*ld has besieged me And*ld surrounded me*i with bitterness and woe.
He*ld has set me in dark places Like*ld the dead of long ago.
He*ln has hedged me in so that I cannot get out; He*ld has made my chain heavy.
Even*ld when I cry and shout, He*ld shuts out my prayer.
He*ld has blocked my ways with hewn stone; He*ld has made my paths crooked.
He*ln has*i been*i to me a bear lying in wait, Like*ild a lion in ambush.
He*ld has turned aside my ways and torn me in pieces; He*ld has made me desolate.
He*ld has bent His bow And*ld set me up as a target for the arrow.
He*ln has caused the arrows of His quiver To*ld pierce my loins.
I*ld have become the ridicule of all my people— Their*ld taunting song all the day.
He*ld has filled me with bitterness, He*ld has made me drink wormwood.
He*ln has also broken my teeth with gravel, And*ld covered me with ashes.
You*ld have moved my soul far from peace; I*ld have forgotten prosperity.
And*ld I said, “My strength and my hope Have*ld perished from the Lord.”*s
Remember*ln my affliction and roaming, The*ld wormwood and the gall.
My*ld soul still remembers And*ld sinks within me.
This*ld I recall to my mind, Therefore*ld I have hope.
Through*iln the Lord’s*s mercies we are not consumed, Because*ld His compassions fail not.
They*ild are*i new every morning; Great*ld is*i Your faithfulness.
“The*ld Lord*s is*i my portion,” says my soul, “Therefore*ld I hope in Him!”
The*ln Lord*s is*i good to those who wait for Him, To*ld the soul who*i seeks Him.
It*ild is*i good that one*i should hope and wait quietly For*ld the salvation of the Lord.*s
It*ild is*i good for a man to bear The*ld yoke in his youth.
Let*ln him sit alone and keep silent, Because*ld God*i has laid it*i on him;
Let*ld him put his mouth in the dust— There*ld may yet be hope.
Let*ld him give his*i cheek to the one who strikes him, And*ild be full of reproach.
For*ln the Lord will not cast off forever.
Though*ld He causes grief, Yet*ld He will show compassion According*ld to the multitude of His mercies.
For*ld He does not afflict willingly, Nor*ld grieve the children of men.
To*ln crush under one’s feet All*ld the prisoners of the earth,
To*ld turn aside the justice due*i a man Before*ld the face of the Most High,
Or*ld subvert a man in his cause— The*ld Lord does not approve.
Who*ln is*i he who*i speaks and it comes to pass, When*ild the Lord has not commanded it?*i
Is*ild it*i not from the mouth of the Most High That*ld woe and well-being proceed?
Why*ld should a living man complain, A*ld man for the punishment of his sins?
Let*ln us search out and examine our ways, And*ld turn back to the Lord;*s
Let*ld us lift our hearts and hands To*ld God in heaven.
We*ld have transgressed and rebelled; You*ld have not pardoned.
You*ln have covered Yourself*i with anger And*ld pursued us; You*ld have slain and*i not pitied.
You*ld have covered Yourself with a cloud, That*ld prayer should not pass through.
You*ld have made us an offscouring and refuse In*ld the midst of the peoples.
All*ln our enemies Have*ld opened their mouths against us.
Fear*ld and a snare have come upon us, Desolation*ld and destruction.
My*ld eyes overflow with rivers of water For*ld the destruction of the daughter of my people.
My*ln eyes flow and do not cease, Without*ld interruption,
Till*ld the Lord*s from heaven Looks*ld down and sees.
My*ld eyes bring suffering to my soul Because*ld of all the daughters of my city.
My*ln enemies without cause Hunted*ld me down like a bird.
They*ld silenced my life in the pit And*ld threw stones at me.
The*ld waters flowed over my head; I*ld said, “I am cut off!”
I*ln called on Your name, O Lord,*s From*ld the lowest pit.
You*ld have heard my voice: “Do*ld not hide Your ear From*ld my sighing, from my cry for help.”
You*ld drew near on the day I called on You, And*ld said, “Do not fear!”
O*ln Lord, You have pleaded the case for my soul; You*ld have redeemed my life.
O*ld Lord,*s You have seen how*i I am wronged; Judge*ld my case.
You*ld have seen all their vengeance, All*ld their schemes against me.
You*ln have heard their reproach, O Lord,*s All*ld their schemes against me,
The*ld lips of my enemies And*ld their whispering against me all the day.
Look*ld at their sitting down and their rising up; I*ld am*i their taunting song.
Repay*ln them, O Lord,*s According*ld to the work of their hands.
Give*ld them a veiled heart; Your*ld curse be*i upon them!
In*ld Your anger, Pursue*ld and destroy them From*ld under the heavens of the Lord.*s
